messages.message: I then get this when trying to run my app with a batch ID

@Wilson :point_up: to take a look at these issues

this particular issue looks like your request is blocked by cloudfront -- is it intermittent?
Nope, not in my testing, each time I send it I get that
Looks like a cloudfront issue will defer to @jayapandian.ponraj who is also on-call

Lee your endpoint is wrong
The correct endpoint is v2/apps/<id>/run

Thanks Anil, I think this is a docs problem then.

https://aihub.instabase.com/docs/aihub/apis/api-reference/run-app/index.html#running-apps-by-app-id

The docs here are unclear and I think incorrect, as its showing the API ROOT as being equal to aihub.instabase.com/api/v2/zero-shot-idp/projects/app (http://aihub.instabase.com/api/v2/zero-shot-idp/projects/app)
it then shows this as the rest of the url - no mention of /apps.
What should the full path be?

When I try with the following i get the same error:

https://aihub.instabase.com/api/v2/apps/61f7325e-5ada-4c69-a8e8-7f73bcd7448a/run

```In this document, API_ROOT defines where to route API requests for file operations, and its value is aihub.instabase.com/api/v2/zero-shot-idp/projects/app (http://aihub.instabase.com/api/v2/zero-shot-idp/projects/app).```

What kerry showed is correct. From your example it should be
```https://aihub.instabase.com/api/v2/zero-shot-idp/projects/app/61f7325e-5ada-4c69-a8e8-7f73bcd7448a/run```
Can you try it again?
